canisius.jim

Class Lights

  • java.lang.Object
    • canisius.jim.Part
      • canisius.jim.Lights

  • public final class Lights
extends canisius.jim.Part
    The Lights Part currently represents the eye lights of the Ruppet. Since the PIC is not set up to handle analog inputs, the methods automatically correct for that such that the lights are digitally controlled. Therefore they currently only turn on and off.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jon Mrowczynski

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lights

        public Lights(java.util.ArrayList<canisius.jim.Part> ruppetParts,
              int midiNote,
              int lowerBound,
              int upperBound)
        This constructor takes the ArrayList of Ruppet Parts that the Ruppet physically possesses.

        It also takes a MIDI note which is the note that is associated with the Lights object which is used to operate the eye lights.

        Lastly it takes as parameters two integer values that represent the lower and upper bounds that the states for the lights can take. This is to set some brightness ranges that the lights can have as well as to make sure that the lights do not get overloaded if they are controlled by an analog output from the PIC microcontroller.

        Parameters:
        ruppetParts - The ArrayList of Parts of the Ruppet.
        midiNote - The MIDI note associated with this Lights object.
        lowerBound - The minimum value for a state for the Lights object.
        upperBound - The maximum value for a state for the Lights object.

    • Method Detail

      • setBrightness

        public void setBrightness(int newBrightness)
        Sets the brightness value of the Ruppet's eye lights.

        First, the integer value is checked to make sure that it represents a valid brightness value. If the new brightness value is valid, it sets the lights to off if the value is less than the maximum brightness value or it turns the lights on if the brightness value is equal to the maximum brightness value.

        Parameters:
        newBrightness - The new brightness value for the eye lights of the Ruppet.

      • on

        public void on()
        Turns the Ruppet's eye lights on.

      • checkAndSetBoundaryValues

        protected boolean checkAndSetBoundaryValues(int lowerBound,
                                            int upperBound)
        This checks to make sure that the lower and upper bound values that were passed into the Lights constructor are valid boundary values. If they are not, then an InvalidParameterException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        checkAndSetBoundaryValues in class canisius.jim.Part
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The minimum brightness value that the lights should have.
        upperBound - The maximum brightness value that the lights should have.
        Returns:
        true if the boundary values are valid.

      • validBrightness

        private boolean validBrightness(int brightness)
        Makes sure that the passed in brightness value is within a given range of values. This range is ultimately determined by the PIC microcontroller firmware and the firmware should be referred to if any modifications to those bounding values need to be changed.
        Parameters:
        brightness - The brightness value that is being checked for validity.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing whether the velocity value is a valid velocity value.
